briefdescription.para: On-disk header for block-sparse matrices (writer side).
Load a dense FP32 matrix from disk.

detaileddescription.para: The file is expected to contain exactly rows*cols floats in row-major order.

memberdef.argsstring: (const float *W, uint32_t rows, uint32_t cols, uint32_t br, uint32_t bc, uint32_t block_rows, uint32_t block_cols, float threshold)
memberdef.name: block_is_nonzero

briefdescription.para: Decide whether a block is non-zero under a simple max-abs rule.

memberdef.argsstring: (const float *W, uint32_t rows, uint32_t cols, uint32_t block_rows, uint32_t block_cols, float threshold, ie_block_sparse_matrix_t *out)
memberdef.name: dense_to_block_sparse

briefdescription.para: Build an ie_block_sparse_matrix_t from a dense matrix in memory.
Write a block-sparse matrix to disk in IEBS format.
Offline converter from dense FP32 matrix to block-sparse binary file.

detaileddescription.para: This tool reads a dense FP32 matrix from disk (row-major, contiguous), applies a simple block pruning rule, and writes a compact block-sparse representation in the format consumed by ie_block_sparse_load().
The on-disk layout matches the header described in sparse_io.c:

Non-zero block decision:
A block is kept if any element has |w| >= threshold.
Otherwise the block is dropped.
The input file is expected to contain rows * cols FP32 values in row-major order with no header.
